bug.author: debadityamandal
bug.description:
I installed stanza from source. After that for testing I opened python interpreter but at the time of importing stanza I am getting ModuleNotFoundError. I am giving my code snippet below- Python 3.7.9 (default, Nov 11 2020, 15:19:12) [GCC 7.5.0] on linux Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
import stanza Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/home/giuser/stanza/stanza/init.py", line 1, in from stanza.pipeline.core import Pipeline File "/home/giuser/stanza/stanza/pipeline/core.py", line 20, in from stanza.pipeline.pos_processor import POSProcessor File "/home/giuser/stanza/stanza/pipeline/pos_processor.py", line 6, in from stanza.models.common.pretrain import Pretrain File "/home/giuser/stanza/stanza/models/common/pretrain.py", line 7, in import lzma File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/lzma.py", line 27, in from _lzma import * ModuleNotFoundError: No module named '_lzma'

comments.comment:
Is there something wrong with your python installation? lzma is a default module as of 3.3 and should not have this problem.
Forgetting about stanza for a moment, can you do this:
python <denchmark-link:#>â€¦</denchmark-link>
>> import lzma
I have installed python3 again. Now it is working. Thank you for your answer.
